Class LibraryMember

java.lang.Object
LibraryMember
public class LibraryMember
extends java.lang.Object
Represents a member of the library with the ability to borrow and return books. Each user has a membership Id, a first and last name, an email, a list of books on loan and a list of messages.

Each user belongs to only one library but can have zero or many books.

Since:
2020-11-28
Version:
1.0
Author:
James Welsh

      Parameters:

    • getMemberId

      public java.lang.String getMemberId()
      Returns:
      the memberId

    • setMemberId

      public void setMemberId​(java.lang.String memberId)
      Sets the value of memberId. This must be a string of length 8 and cannot be the same as any other member of the library.
      Parameters:
      memberId - The memberId string to set.

    • getFirstName

      public java.lang.String getFirstName()
      Returns:
      the firstName

    • getEmail

      public java.lang.String getEmail()
      Returns:
      the email

    • setEmail

      public void setEmail​(java.lang.String email)
      Changes the users email address. It checks that the String entered contains an "@" and is therefore deemed to be a valid email address.
      Parameters:
      email - A string representing the library members email address. It must contain the '@' character at some point in it.

    • getBooks

      public java.util.ArrayList<Book> getBooks()
      Returns:
      the books

    • getMessages

      public void printMemberDetails()
      Prints all the data members of the class in an easy to read format.

    • getFullName

      public java.lang.String getFullName()
      gets the library members full name.
      Returns:
      library members full name.

    • printMessages

      public void printMessages()
      Prints all the users messages. If there are no messages it prints an appropriate string instead.

    • reviceMessage

      public void reviceMessage​(java.lang.String message)
      Adds a message to the users list of messages.
      Parameters:
      message - The message the user is receiving. Cannot be an empty string.

    • addBook

      public void addBook​(Book book)
      Adds a book to the users list of books and sets the member as its holder. If the book is not available then the user is shown an appropriate message.
      Parameters:
      book - The book the user is attempting to take out.

    • returnBook

      public void returnBook​(Book book)
      Allows the library member to return the book back to the library, where it will be available for another member to take out.
      Parameters:
      book - The book the user is attempting to return.

    • printBooks

      public void printBooks()
      Prints details on all of the books the user currently has on loan. If the user has no books an appropriate message is shown.

    • numberOfBooksOnLoan

      public int numberOfBooksOnLoan()
      Gets the number of books the user currently has on loan.
      Returns:
      The number of books the libraryMember currently has out on loan.
